text: Q.21 A Boolean function must satisfy the condition f(a, b, ¢) = f(c, b, a). How many such functions are possible? Solution : 16 To satisfy the required condition f(a, b, ¢) = f(c, b, a), the possible values on Boolean variables a, b and c are 000 or 010 or 101 or 111. Using above four possible combinations on Boolean variables a, b and ¢, total number of Boolean functions are 4C,+4C, +4C,+4C,+4C, = 1+4+6+4+1=16 -, Answer is 16.
